Miles has a detailed Emergency Action Plan (ERP) for their facility.  The purpose of this plan is to provide the means for rapidly determining the appropriate response for any emergency that may develop at the facility such as an accidental release of anhydrous ammonia.

 
To address the five year accident history is not an issue, since the facility for the past 5 years has no history of reportable ammonia releases.  To prevent and/or minimize any potential future release of anhydrous ammonia, J.H. Miles is implementing a detailed Risk Management program (Preventative Program 2) developed for their facility in Norfolk, Virginia.  The Preventative Program 2 provides extensive maintenance and operator/mechanic training to ensure that the system's mechanical integrity is maintained for the life of the covered process.  Program 2 also incorporates administrative controls when modifications are made to the covered process (ammonia refrigeration system), so that the training and preventative programs are updated as the system expands and changes.

J.H. Miles? planned changes to improve safety include being proactive in addressing any recommendations resulting from the Process Hazard Analysis, Offsite Consequences, incident investigations , program audits, and other safety issues that may arise.  The flexibility of the program allows J.H. Miles to respond effectively to prevent or minimize any potential of exposing J.H. Miles employees, the surrounding public, and/or the environment to a release of anhydrous ammonia.
